titles.title: Cooperative Fisheries Management Act of 1995
Cooperative Fisheries Management Act of 1996
Cooperative Fisheries Management Act of 1996
To authorize appropriations to carry out the Interjurisdictional Fisheries Act of 1986 and the Anadromous Fish Conservation Act.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Fisheries, Wildlife and Oceans.
Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee by Voice Vote.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Resources. H. Rept. 104-517.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 252.

action.text: Mr. Torkildsen moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

At the conclusion of debate, the chair put the question on the motion to suspend the rules. Mr. Torkildsen objected to the vote on the grounds that a quorum was not present. Further proceedings on the motion were postponed. The point of no quorum was withdrawn.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by recorded vote (2/3 required); 406 - 0 (Roll no. 128).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce.

bill.summary: 4/23/1996--Passed House amended. Cooperative Fisheries Management Act of 1996 - Amends the Interjurisdictional Fisheries Act of 1986 to authorize appropriations to carry out the Act and to support the efforts of specified interstate commissions to develop interstate fishery management plans. Revises requirements regarding assistance (currently, grants) for fishery disaster relief, including allowing assistance to State and local government agencies and nonprofit organizations as well as to individuals. Modifies assistance limits. Regulates the awarding of assistance under a fishing capacity reduction program in a fishery. Removes requirements that the Secretary of Commerce establish assistance limitations, terms, and conditions regarding the means of demonstrating loss. Amends the Anadromous Fish Conservation Act to authorize appropriations to carry out the Act. Amends the Fisheries Act of 1995 to extend the deadline for implementation of specified recommendations of the International Commission for the Conservation of Atlantic Tunas regarding yellowfin tuna.
